items.title: Government agency deliberately broke law for years, federal watchdog finds
items.description: Services Australia has known it was not fully complying with new child support laws since 2019, according to a scathing report released by the Commonwealth Ombudsman.

items.title: How a peaceful Invasion Day gathering in Perth turned to chaos
items.description: Premier Roger Cook says the way an orderly protest was targeted "runs against the very heart of what it means to be Australian". So what really happened in Perth's CBD on Australia Day?

items.title: The problem gnawing at China's economy
items.description: Unlike many Western economies, Chinese households stash away more than 40 per cent of their income. But the pressure to boost local consumption is mounting for Beijing.

items.title: Trump sends 'border czar' to Minnesota after shooting of nurse Alex Pretti
items.description: An American citizen, Alex Pretti, was shot by federal agents during a continuing Trump administration immigration crackdown in the city.

items.title: Alcaraz 'suffocates' rivals, but de Minaur feels he has room to breathe
items.description: World number one Carlos Alcaraz has defeated Alex de Minaur each time they have played, but the Australian is not overawed ahead of their quarterfinal clash.

items.title: Tiny country town could be one of the hottest places on Earth today
items.description: The mercury in Ouyen, in Victoria's north-west, is tipped to hit 49C amid what could be a record-breaking heatwave in the state.

items.title: 'Sydney don't know what's next': TikTok account banned over Bondi attack posts
items.description: The social media giant deleted the account and a host of other profiles promoting Islamic State and other violent ideology only after questioning by the ABC last week.

items.title: 'A hero of Israel': Last Israeli hostage in Gaza found
items.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu confirmed that the remains of 24-year-old Ran Gvili had been found and identified.

items.title: Private jet crashes as major winter storm kills at least 18 across US
items.description: Almost 200 million Americans are under cold weather alerts as snow, sleet and freezing rain affects swathes of the country from Texas to New England, with temperatures set to fall dangerously low this week.

items.title: How a purge at the top of China's military could impact Taiwan
items.description: Another two senior generals are under investigation for alleged corruption in China and that has big consequences for President Xi Jinping.

items.title: Five quick hits: An Italian tantrum, masterful Musetti and a tennis ball straight to the face
items.description: Sabalenka and Alcaraz denied fitness tracking devices, Darderi has a tantrum and Siegemund cops a tennis ball to the face. Here are the quick hits from the Australian Open.

items.title: Russia, Ukraine and US plan further trilateral talks on ending war
items.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says discussions between envoys from Ukraine, Russia and the US in Abu Dhabi last week aimed at ending Moscow's invasion have left some political issues unresolved.

items.title: Paying 'money just to breathe' in one of the world's most polluted cities
items.description: Poor air quality in Delhi has impacted nearly all aspects of life with residents saying they have lost many of the "simple joys" such as opening a window or going for a walk outside.

items.title: Texas police urge 'wanted' Australian to hand himself in as sightings reported
items.description: Texan authorities say an extradition order may be required to resolve the "legal limbo" involving Australian man Izaak Michell.

items.title: Tips for getting your finances in order in 2026
items.description: It might be time to devote some of your energy and good intentions towards your finances.

items.title: Quiz: How well do you know your way around the world?
items.description: Which food is thrown in the re-enactment of a medieval food fight? And which airport is the world's busiest?

items.title: The Godmother of Punk and the 'inventor' of black honoured in new exhibition
items.description: The revolutionary work of fashion designers Vivienne Westwood and Rei Kawakubo is celebrated with style, surprise and punk flair in this new exhibition.

items.title: Elite marines among 42 people missing in Indonesian landslide
items.description: The search is ongoing for survivors after the pre-dawn landslide on the slopes of Mount Burangrang in West Java province killed at least two dozen people at the weekend.

items.title: The collateral damage from Trump's quest to deport immigrants
items.description: Minneapolis has become the flashpoint of an aggressive immigration enforcement operation ordered by the Trump administration and pitched as a campaign against undocumented criminals.

items.title: Traditional owners heartbroken by dingo cull after Piper James's death
items.description: The Queensland government euthanises six dingoes involved in Piper James's death on K'gari, and is expected to cull more in the coming days.

items.title: Liquidator appointed to wind up Hellyer Metals
items.description: Hellyer Metals, which until recently operated Tasmania's Hellyer gold mine, has gone into liquidation. But the company says the mine is unaffected because it is now operated by a different company.

items.title: The 150 Indigenous kids who made a movie without Hollywood's permission
items.description: The beautifully animated, crowdsourced movie Imagine introduces a wealth of Indigenous knowledge to audiences in the funniest way possible and hopes to generate real change.

items.title: 'Gentle and kind': Tributes flow for Lake Cargelligo shooting victims
items.description: A pregnant woman who was one of three people shot dead in a suspected domestic violence attack in a remote NSW town has been remembered as a gentle and kind person.

items.title: Human remains found near Charters Towers belong to Jayden Penno-Tompsett
items.description: Human remains found in north Queensland belong to a missing New South Wales man last seen eight years ago, according to police.

items.title: How to know if you're 'stuck' on unhealthy life goals
items.description: Experts say knowing when to abandon or change your goals may be just as important as persistence.
